column4: Tik ... is a process suposed to stay defunct after I try to kill the pid with sudo?
so still...a reboot required...so much for sudo killing pids then :))
nothing on that sudo killall transmission
Also try the following: "sudo killall -KILL transmission" and "sudo killall -SEGV transmission"
Well, then... all you can do is either reboot or restart X: "sudo reboot" and "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart" correspondently
ahh...I was goin to gksu nautilus...but your command seems better :)
huh, uh... Sorry. find /var/log -type f -exec rm '{}' \;
it is..should I worry about them?
As for I never used wi-fi, I can't tell :D
